entry.title: rogue winds
entry.summary:
Author: minvara

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,256Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 2

Summary: Peter is barely getting by, having a reluctant father figure in Tony Stark, and living on Aunt May’s superstitious culinary experiments. All the while, strange intergalactic happenings have spread all over New York. And there’s a random letter branded onto his chest.Jason would really like to think that things have been looking up for him; it turns out, nope. By the way, is there a name for the disease heartburn?Or, Peter swears it started with an accident + Dick has a soft spot for strays.

entry.title: Every Inch of You
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,799Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 35

Summary: "This is a love story." | "This is a detective story"When Clark Kent follows a story into Gotham, he doesn’t expect to find himself face-to-face with the city’s true guardian: a bat with fangs, claws, and a half-feral silhouette in the shadows. Suspicious, circling him like prey, Batman tests every ounce of Clark’s resolve—only for Clark’s clumsy optimism to slip through anyway (“What the hay, are those fangs?”).Between the silk shawls and champagne smiles of Bruce Wayne, Gotham’s Pretty Boy Playboy, and the smudged-eyeliner hunger of the Bat with Fangs, Clark finds himself drawn to both—the golden boy in the sun and the monster in the dark. He doesn’t break Bruce’s walls with force, but with patience, reverence, and devotion.The monster who refuses to hurt the one he loves, and the hero who would even offer his own blood to keep him alive.

entry.title: Temptation is One Hell of a Thing
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,412Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 130

Summary: Bruce Wayne never expected to walk into a church again—let alone with his four-year-old son in his arms. But when a meeting with Clark Kent, a priest. It turns into more than polite conversation, Bruce finds himself disarmed by a man who shouldn’t have surprised him at all. Clark is broad-shouldered, and impossibly kind; a believer in things Bruce turned his back on the day of his parents’ funeral.Bruce is skeptical, Clark is steadfast. Their ideologies clash from the moment they sit across from one another: billionaire pragmatism versus the faith of a priest. But somewhere between coloring books at Clark’s desk and quiet invitations to community fairs, a dangerous warmth grows. Bruce doesn’t know how to name it, and Clark doesn’t dare.Because whatever is happening between them—it shouldn’t. Bruce pushes, searching for the language he can’t bring himself to say aloud, while Clark whispers what he shouldn’t confess at all: I can’t. A vow binds him to the Church, but his heart betrays him in every secret meeting, every glance held too long.It shouldn’t work. It can’t work. But it does. And as much Clark Kent prays, temptation seeps through.

entry.title: Two Heroes and a Baby
entry.summary:
Author: xxEmilee_Lunaxx

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,066Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 169

Summary: In this AU, 19-year-old Bruce Wayne adopts 4-year-old Dick Grayson after he is orphaned by a tragic event at Haly's Circus. Bruce is in over his head trying to juggle establishing himself as a responsible and valuable asset to Wayne Enterprises, beginning his vigilante work in Gotham as The Batman, and parenting a young child despite not knowing where to start. After struggling to get good press and constantly being seen as an irresponsible nepo baby, he sets up an interview at The Daily Planet. That's where he meets 19-year-old intern Clark Kent, who is eager to write a good story to begin his career as a journalist.After Clark agrees to keep an eye on Dick during his interview, Bruce realizes he has a knack for watching children, especially young Dick Grayson. Bruce asks Clark to come live with him at Wayne Manor on a 6 month assignment as Dick's nanny, and in return, will let Clark write the story of a lifetime--an expose on his life that no other reporter has even come close to. Clark reluctantly agrees, but is hiding a secret from Bruce--his life as the superhero, Superman! As the two begin their friendship and double lives as heroes, they learn valuable lessons in friendship, love, and parenting.

entry.title: Sunshine (And The Creature it Shadows)
entry.summary:
Author: auravee

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,004Chapters: 3/4Kudos: 32

Summary: "I was thinking we could help each other out, potentially. If you were willing, of course.”He finishes with another blinding smile of his, and distantly, Bruce realizes the sun has started rising directly behind him, outlining the man in a supernatural sort of glow.“I’m not.” He says with finality. For a second, Superman looks uncharacteristically crestfallen, splitting his act in two before it’s sealed back up again. “I work alone.”ORBruce works alone, until he doesn't. (Enter Dick Grayson, stage left.)It opens his guarded heart to something much brighter than the shadows.

Author: prismbtrz

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,315Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 19

Summary: Clark spent days searching for something, turning over every stone a reporter could reach and, when that wasn’t enough, calling on the kind of resources no reporter was supposed to have. He drifted over Gotham’s skyline, eyes cutting through brick and steel, ears tuned to whispers in alleys and boardrooms alike. He was close to giving up when, finally, he managed to find it. Personal deposits. Hidden accounts. And of all places, it traced back to Smallville. From there, the trail was easy to follow.Wayne was buying kryptonite, illegally, in bulk.Or, Clark is set on finding out what Bruce Wayne is hiding, and Bruce couldn't say no to the reporter asking him for a week-long interview.

Summary: "What are you doing?" Bruce asks, his voice shaky."I just want to thank you, Mr. Wayne," Clark murmurs into the soft fabric of Bruce's slacks, "for the opportunity to talk to you in person."Suddenly, he gasps, as if remembering something, "Oh, and for the new carpet, of course. It is much softer than the previous one."
